sndlib.core.problem
Class Problem

java.lang.Object
  sndlib.core.problem.Problem
Direct Known Subclasses:
SolvedProblem
public class Problem
extends java.lang.Object

A Problem couples a Network with a Model.

To check the feasibility of a Problem or to calculate statistics of the same, have a look at ProblemValidators and ProblemStatistics respectively.

Author:
Roman Klaehne
See Also:
Network, Model, ProblemValidators, ProblemStatistics

demands

public java.util.Collection<Demand> demands()
Returns a Collection view of demands in the underlying network.

The returned collection is unmodifiable. That means that each attempt to modify the collection will cause an UnsupportedOperationException.

Returns:
an unmodifiable collection view of the demans in the underlying network

links

public java.util.Collection<Link> links()
Returns a Collection view of links in the underlying network.

The returned collection is unmodifiable. That means that each attempt to modify the collection will cause an UnsupportedOperationException.

Returns:
an unmodifiable collection view of the links in the underlying network

nodes

public java.util.Collection<Node> nodes()
Returns a Collection view of nodes in the underlying network.

The returned collection is unmodifiable. That means that each attempt to modify the collection will cause an UnsupportedOperationException.

Returns:
an unmodifiable collection view of the nodes in the underlying network

operatingStates

public java.util.Set<OperatingState> operatingStates()
Returs the operating states of this problem.

If there is no survivability mechanism specified in this problem's survivability model the returned set will only contain the normal operating State (NOS; see OperatingState.NOS). Otherwise the set will also contain all states corresponding to single link failures.

Returns:
a set containing the operating states of this problem

public Model getModel()
Returns this problem's model.

Returns:
this problem's model
